column4: I have a d-link router; my ubuntu has 192.168.0.1; my router has a WAN IP, how can I find out the wan IP from ubuntu?
from outside (other computer/internet) or accessing to you router
what I meant is to run a script in ubuntu box who mails me the WAN Dynamic IP so anytime I can access it
there's tools which do that automaticly, and then you have to just remebmer one hostname like nmsa.no-ip.org when connecting
my D-link has this dyndns feature, but it doesn't work ok at all
don't use that, use no-ip from you computer :)
no-ip work from my private ip?
what do you mean by private ip
you always get lan ip if your using nat :/
so? how do I know my WAN ?
I see :) 'thnx; one more thing: is there a auto update software for no-ip or dyndns >
